lesson_html:
• Hello! - A common way to greet someone.
  • How are you? - A friendly way to ask about someone's well-being.
  • Good morning! - Used in the morning until around noon.
  • Good afternoon! - Used from noon until around 6 PM.
  • Good evening! - Used after 6 PM to greet someone.

items.en: What time do you usually wake up?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's waking time.

items.en: Do you have any plans for tonight?
items.explanation_en: This question inquires about evening plans.
This question asks about the well-being of someone's family.

items.en: What did you do last weekend?
items.target: ¿Qué hiciste el fin de semana pasado?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about activities from the previous weekend.
This question asks if someone is having a good time on vacation.

items.en: What are you doing this weekend?
items.target: ¿Qué vas a hacer este fin de semana?
items.explanation_en: This question inquires about plans for the upcoming weekend.
This question asks about someone's feelings on that day.

items.en: Did you have a good day?
items.explanation_en: This question inquires about the quality of someone's day.
This question asks about someone's favorite leisure activity.
This question inquires about the frequency of someone's exercise routine.
